dialogue.htmlContent:
Deciding that you want to head inside 'The Crossed Blades', you approach the entrance to the tavern and push open the old, wooden door. Although the rusty hinges produce an ear-splitting screech in protest, this unpleasant noise is drowned out by the rowdy shouting, laughing, and cursing which fills the tavern's gloomy, smoky interior. [pc.Stepping] forwards and letting the door swing shut behind you, you pause for a moment to take in the scene before you.

The tavern's large, open-plan floorspace is filled with dozens of mismatched tables and chairs of varying shapes and sizes. Around these tables can be seen a mix of patrons every bit as diverse as the furniture they're seated upon, and apart from creating a huge amount of noise, this crowd can be seen to be drinking, eating, smoking, arguing, kissing, slapping, and, in just a couple of instances, drunkenly fucking. Although a few of the closest individuals stop and give you a look as you enter the tavern, their business is far more interesting than your entrance, and they quickly return to their previous conversation.

After you've taken a moment to look upon the wild scene before you, you move your gaze to the other parts of the tavern. Opposite to where you're standing, and separated from the entrance by several occupied tables, you see what looks to be the tavern's bar. You also note that around the edges of the large, open-plan floorspace, dimly-lit seating looks to be populated by a different sort of client√®le, who look far less happy and considerably more dangerous than the people who are seated at the tables.

Taking another [pc.step] forwards into the warm, smoky atmosphere of the tavern's gloomy interior, you wonder whether to head over to the bar to perhaps order a drink, or maybe instead to turn around and head back outside...
Finding yourself once again at the tavern's main entrance, you wonder whether to push open the old, wooden door and head back outside, or perhaps to turn around and return to the bar...

Deciding that you've had enough of the tavern's gloomy, smoky atmosphere, you push open the old, wooden door and, ignoring the screeching, grinding sound of the rusty hinges, [pc.step] back out into the relatively fresh air of Elis's alleyways...

Standing at #IF(game.isMetricSizes()) well over two metres tall, #ELSE over seven feet tall, #ENDIF and with a remarkable shade of green skin, this black-haired woman looks startlingly similar to a generic orc from some kind of fantasy setting.
